trans-unit.source: Represents a key identifier clause that is based on XML.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.GenericXmlSecurityKeyIdentifierClause"></xref> class by using the specified XML element.

The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityKeyIdentifierClause.ClauseType%2A> property is initialized to `null` and the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityKeyIdentifierClause.DerivationLength%2A> property is initialized to zero in the new instance.
The XML element that represents the key identifier clause.
Sets the value of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.GenericXmlSecurityKeyIdentifierClause.ReferenceXml"></xref> property.
referenceXML is `null`.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.GenericXmlSecurityKeyIdentifierClause"></xref> class by using the specified XML element, nonce, and derivation length.
The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityKeyIdentifierClause.ClauseType%2A> property is initialized to `null` in the new instance.
The XML element that represents the key identifier clause.
Sets the value of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.GenericXmlSecurityKeyIdentifierClause.ReferenceXml"></xref> property.
An array of <xref href="System.Byte"></xref> that contains the nonce that was used to create a derived key.
Sets the value that is returned by the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityKeyIdentifierClause.GetDerivationNonce"></xref> method.
The size of the derived key.
Sets the value of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityKeyIdentifierClause.DerivationLength"></xref> property.
referenceXML is `null`.
Returns a value that indicates whether specified key identifier clause matches the current instance.

For the match to succeed, the specified key identifier clause must be assignable from <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.GenericXmlSecurityKeyIdentifierClause> and its markup (XML) must match that of this instance.

(The <xref:System.Xml.XmlNode.OuterXml%2A> property of the element specified by the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.GenericXmlSecurityKeyIdentifierClause.ReferenceXml%2A> property is compared for the two instances.)
The key identifier clause to which to compare current instance.
`true` if the specified key identifier clause matches the current instance; otherwise, `false`.
Gets the XML element that represents the key identifier clause.
The XML element that represents the key identifier clause.
